Menachem Friedman (; born 1936 – 16 March 2020) is an Israeli sociologist. He was the Emeritus Professor of sociology at Bar Ilan University, Ramat-Gan. He worked on the field of religion and the confrontations between religious and secular Judaism in modern history. He also studied the modern process of Halachic decision making.
Friedman died on 16 March 2020 at the age of 83.
